H0.text: Tilting of Earth's axis causes day and night on Earth.

H1.text: Rotation of Earth on its axis causes day and night on Earth.

H2.text: Movement of Earth around the sun causes day and night on Earth.

H3.text: Movement of the sun around Earth causes day and night on Earth.

A4.text: Earth's rotation period relative to the International Celestial Reference Frame is 86 164.098 903 691 seconds of mean solar time (23h 56m 4.098903691s).

A5.text: The mean solar day is longer than the stellar day by about 3 minutes 56 seconds due to Earth's orbital motion around the Sun.
